sentence.Network_en: He gently opened the throttle, and the ship began to ease forward.
sentence.Network_cn: 他轻轻松开油门杆，轮船开始缓缓前行。

sentence.Network_en: You have to push the throttle forward for more power.
sentence.Network_cn: 你得把油门杆往前推来加大马力。

sentence.Network_en: He stepped swiftly to the controls to throttle back the engine.
sentence.Network_cn: 他快步来到控制台跟前，减小了油门。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): perhaps a frequentative, from throat; the noun (dating from the mid 16th cent. in sense 2) is perhaps a diminutive of throat, but the history of the word is not clear

entry.tran: 掐死;勒死;掐住…的脖子;使窒息
entry.def: To throttle someone means to kill or injure them by squeezing their throat or tightening something around it and preventing them from breathing.

example.ex: The attacker then tried to throttle her with wire...
example.tran: 然后袭击者企图用电线勒死她。

example.ex: He throttled her and hid her body.
example.tran: 他掐死她后把她的尸体藏了起来。

entry.def: If you say that something or someone is throttling a process, institution, or group, you mean that they are restricting it severely or destroying it.

example.ex: He said the overvaluation of sterling was throttling industry.
example.tran: 他认为英镑价值过高阻碍了工业发展。

entry.tran: (汽车、飞机的)节流阀，油门杆，油门踏板
entry.def: The throttle of a motor vehicle or aircraft is the device, lever, or pedal that controls the quantity of fuel entering the engine and is used to control the vehicle's speed.

example.ex: He gently opened the throttle, and the ship began to ease forward...
example.tran: 他轻轻松开油门杆，轮船开始缓缓前行。

example.ex: You have to push the throttle forward for more power.
example.tran: 你得把油门杆往前推来加大马力。

entry.def: Throttle is the power that is obtained by using a throttle.
If you say that something is done at full throttle, you mean that it is done with great speed and enthusiasm.

example.ex: He lived his life at full throttle.
example.tran: 他过着激情四射的生活。

means.word_mean: 1. a valve that regulates the supply of fuel to the engine
2. a pedal that controls the throttle valve;

sentences.sentence: "restrict the use of this parking lot"
"limit the time you can spend with your friends"

means.word_mean: 2. kill by squeezing the throat of so as to cut off the air;

sentences.sentence: "A man in Boston has been strangling several dozen prostitutes"

example.en: He bent the throttle at ninety.
example.zh: 他以 90 码的速度高速驾车。

auth_sentence.content: It can throttle up quickly to handle peak loads.
auth_sentence.res_content: It can throttle up quickly to handle peak loads.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It can throttle up quickly to handle peak loads.

auth_sentence.content: Hubert felt he could throttle her for cheating him.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hubert felt he could throttle her for cheating him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hubert felt he could throttle her for cheating him.

auth_sentence.content: Louboutin opened up the throttle on Rue de Rivoli.
auth_sentence.res_content: Louboutin opened up the throttle on Rue de Rivoli.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Louboutin opened up the throttle on Rue de Rivoli.

means.word_mean: 控制油、气流的阀门；节流阀；节流杆；风门；风门杆

sentences.en: He drove the police car at full throttle and dashed at the gangsters.
sentences.cn: 他驾驶着警车开足马力向匪徒冲去。

sentences.en: He’s determined to live his whole life at full throttle.
sentences.cn: 他决心开足马力过好一生。

sentences.en: This fight scarf is throttling me.
sentences.cn: 这条束得紧紧的围巾快要把我窒息死了。

sentences.en: These government restrictions are going to throttle our trade.
sentences.cn: 这些政府的限制将要扼杀我们的贸易。

sentences.en: The pilot got very low before he throttled back.
sentences.cn: 飞行员减速之前下降得很低。
